title: It's Settled: CVS Health Is Headed Up to $80
text:
During the fast-paced Lightning Round segment of Mad Money Tuesday night Jim Cramer was asked by one caller about CVS Health (CVS) : "I see this stock going to $80 by year end," said Cramer.

Let's check out the charts and indicators to see if they agree with Cramer's bullish year-end call.

In the daily bar chart of CVS, below, we can see that the stock based in March, April, May and June. This four-month period of accumulation was the start of a rally. Prices are now above the rising 50-day moving average line after a number of successful tests of the line. The 200-day moving average line is also bottoming and could soon display a positive slope.

The On-Balance-Volume (OBV) line based until August and now it too rising. The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator is bullish and pointing higher.

In the weekly bar chart of CVS, below, we can see that prices are above the bottoming 40-week moving average line. The weekly OBV line has been climbing higher since March and tells us that buyers of CVS have been more aggressive for months.

The MACD oscillator has been bullish since September.

In this Point and Figure chart of CVS, below, we can see the base pattern and a potential upside price target of $80. Point and Figure charts do not consider time but Cramer and the chart are in agreement on the price target.

Bottom-line strategy: The charts and indicators suggest we continue to hold a long position in CVS. Our target is $80 (too).

(CVS is a holding in Jim Cramer's Action Alerts PLUS member club. Want to be alerted before Jim Cramer buys or sells CVS? Learn more now.)
description: Charts and indicators agree with Jim Cramer's bullish year-end call for CVS stock....CVS
authors: Cvs Health Is Headed Up To
Indicators Agree With Jim Cramer'S Bullish Year-End Call.
